alert.note: Alert for Barbour (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Barbour County through 415 PM CDT... At 344 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gaino to near Blue Springs State Park to near Doster. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clio, Blue Springs, Tyler Crossroads, Blue Springs State Park, Texasville and Millers Ford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
